Artists contribute in so many ways, but they all have one thing in common: they don’t just talk about “less but better.” They fully embrace the Essentialist way. 🎨

No matter what job or industry you’re in, you can choose to do the same.

By now, you should have a good grasp of the core ideas and skills of an Essentialist. In this chapter, it’s time to take that leap and learn how to use those skills to not just practice Essentialism occasionally, but to **become** a true Essentialist.

### MAJORING IN MINOR ACTIVITIES

There’s a big difference between being a Nonessentialist who sometimes uses Essentialist practices and being an Essentialist who occasionally slips into Nonessentialist habits. The key question is: “What’s your major and what’s your minor?” Most of us have a mix of both, but the real question is, which one defines you at your core? 🤔

**PAGE SUMMARY:** To truly embrace Essentialism, one must choose to become an Essentialist at their core rather than merely practicing it occasionally.
